trip_details.description: Ottawa is the capital city of Canada, located in the province of Ontario. It is known for its beautiful architecture, rich history, and vibrant culture. The city is home to many national museums, galleries, and landmarks, including the Parliament Hill, the National Gallery of Canada, and the Canadian War Museum. Visitors can also enjoy outdoor activities such as cycling, hiking, and boating along the Rideau Canal. Ottawa is a popular destination for foodies, with a diverse culinary scene offering everything from traditional Canadian dishes to international cuisine. The city also hosts many festivals and events throughout the year, making it a lively and exciting place to visit.

itinerary.name: Exploring Downtown Ottawa
itinerary.highlights: Parliament Hill, ByWard Market, National Gallery of Canada

places.name: Parliament Hill
places.description: Parliament Hill is the heart of Ottawa and the seat of the Canadian government. Visitors can take a guided tour of the Parliament buildings, learn about Canadian history and politics, and enjoy stunning views of the city from the Peace Tower. The Changing of the Guard ceremony takes place every morning during the summer months.

places.name: ByWard Market
places.description: ByWard Market is a bustling outdoor market with over 600 vendors selling fresh produce, artisanal goods, and local crafts. It is also home to many restaurants, cafes, and bars, making it a popular spot for foodies. Visitors can also find street performers and live music in the market.
places.famous_nearby: Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica, National Gallery of Canada

places.name: National Gallery of Canada
places.description: The National Gallery of Canada is the country's premier art museum, showcasing a vast collection of Canadian and international art. The museum's striking architecture and beautiful setting make it a must-visit for art lovers. Visitors can also enjoy guided tours, workshops, and special exhibitions.

itinerary.name: Discovering Ottawa's History
itinerary.highlights: Canadian Museum of History, Rideau Hall, Canadian War Museum

places.name: Canadian Museum of History
places.description: The Canadian Museum of History is the most visited museum in Canada, showcasing the country's rich history and diverse cultures. Visitors can explore interactive exhibits, watch live performances, and learn about Canada's Indigenous peoples, early settlers, and modern history.
places.famous_nearby: Parliament Hill, National Gallery of Canada

places.name: Rideau Hall
places.description: Rideau Hall is the official residence of the Governor General of Canada, the representative of the Queen in Canada. Visitors can take a guided tour of the historic building, explore the beautiful grounds, and learn about the role of the Governor General in Canadian government.

places.name: Canadian War Museum
places.description: The Canadian War Museum is dedicated to preserving and showcasing Canada's military history. Visitors can explore exhibits on Canada's involvement in various wars and conflicts, as well as view a collection of military artifacts and vehicles.
places.famous_nearby: Parliament Hill, National Gallery of Canada

itinerary.name: Outdoor Adventures in Ottawa
itinerary.highlights: Rideau Canal, Gatineau Park, Dow's Lake

places.name: Rideau Canal
places.description: The Rideau Canal is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular spot for outdoor activities. Visitors can take a scenic boat tour, rent a bike or kayak, or simply stroll along the canal and enjoy the beautiful views. In the winter, the canal turns into the world's largest skating rink.
places.tips: outdoor activities, scenic views, UNESCO World Heritage Site

places.name: Gatineau Park
places.description: Gatineau Park is a beautiful natural area just outside of Ottawa, offering hiking trails, scenic lookouts, and picnic areas. Visitors can also enjoy swimming, boating, and camping in the park. In the fall, the park is a popular spot for leaf peeping.
